data.title: Fixed blend modes for 2D particles
data.body:
The 2D particles had missing blend mode functions for
BlendMode::BLEND_SUBTRACT and BLEND_SUBTRACTALPHA. The values for the
functions have been copied from OGLGraphics.cpp.

If C++11 is enabled, the size of the struct is checked with a static
assertion, now.

data.title: MinGW-w64 XInput SDL compiling error
data.body:
Compiling on a brand new MinGW install:

Mingw-builds ver 6.3.0 x64

Compiling ThirdParty/SDL/src/core/windows/SDL_xinput.c give re-definition errors for the structures typedef'ed as XINPUT_GAMEPAD_EX and XINPUT_STATE_EX, for having already been defined in the xinput.h header in the mingw install. Removing these struct declarations from SDL_xinput.h fixes the issue as a hack fix.

data.title: Texture Streaming
data.body:
This is a feature request. Texture streaming would be really nice to have in the engine. Building quite large open world with Urho is difficult in terms of GPU memory consumption because of the lack of texture streaming feature in the engine.

How difficult it would be to implement it ? 

Is there some rather easy solution to lower the GPU memory consumption with the actual engine code ? 

Thanks !

data.title: Transparent material ordering distance problem
data.body:
![transparent render order problem](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7088062/24814575/e5a7d8e2-1bda-11e7-914e-b0c0c58e8aa7.png)

I'm not sure how the distance from camera is calculated. Seems to be the center/node of the geometry.

Perhaps it can be solved by using the distance from the nearest point.
Or maybe there's a way to do depth check with transparent materials?

data.title: Fix crash in AngelScript, improve Editor.
data.body:
Fixing critical error in AngelScript, cause segfault on my script.
Add color wheel in Editor for Text3D component.

data.title: macOS universal binary CI build failed
data.body: I guess we should not be surprised that out of the blue homebrew "readline" (a very minor/optional library dependency that we could do without) decided to provide only x86_64 arch in its latest version instead of universal binary containing both i386 and x86_64 archs like it used to, because Apple has been phasing out the 32 bit support for years now. But because of that, now our universal binary CI build failed for the i386 arch. Our CI build is still configured to do universal binary build simply because our build system is capable of doing so and it is kind of cool, at least to me. But sentiment aside, I would like to ask whether it is really time now to phase out 32 bit mode in our macOS build?

data.title: Texture2D depth
data.body: Should Texture2D have a depth of 1, so that, for example, data size calculations with the width, height, and depth (from GetWidth(),...) give accurate (non-zero) results?

data.title: Enable sound cause crashing on iOS device
data.body:
The latest master branch may introduced an issue:

if I enable the sound, it will crash on iOS devices (iOS 10.3(14E277), Xcode 8.3(8E162)).

Steps to repeat the issue:

Modify Sample.inl in the 6th sample (Skeletal Animation), change:
    engineParameters_[EP_SOUND]        = false;
to
    engineParameters_[EP_SOUND]        = true;

Then build and run, the app will crash every time.

data.title: Improve AngelScript API dump, object attribute animations, 2D-particles
data.body:
In AngelScript API dump fixed template classes dump, add ctors/dtor dump in classes.
Also add some defines.
In object attribute animations add the ability to specify a child node by name when setting attribute animation path.
In 2D particles fix particle emitting duration, add event for ending particles emitting and for all particles over.

data.title: Fix Thread::GetCurrentThreadID() if threading is disabled.
data.body: When URHO3D_THREADING is not defined, Thread::GetCurrentThreadID() was missing a return statement. Also the helpers for invoking a thread should be static, which will hide their symbols.

data.title: Probably leak of NodeImpl (missed delete impl_)
make shader error logs show the true line number and the source file of the error
data.body:
hello, since many files are glued together in one single generated string for a shader, when (for example) opengl detects errors on the shaders the log with the information about the errors shows line numbers relative to the generated string, it can be difficult to fix errors that way, it would be better if,  instead of just displaying "ERROR :0:2122 dasdad" it displays "ERROR sourceFile.glsl :0:112 dada " so one knows that the source of the error is in that file and in that line,,

 I haked a bit the code and I have a working implementation for opengl, I just modified the Shader and OGShaderVariation so the output string has tags to identify when starts and ends a file in the generated string, and in the shader error detection a search is performed for the patterns :ERROR: %d:%d: (it is a simple search using the String methods) and the line numbers relative to the generated string are replaced with line numbers relative to the file from what that string section was taken.

data.title: Getting Started Template
data.body: I'm new to this engine, and I'm not that much pro when it comes to C++. So it would be amazing if there was a Getting Started template to kickstart a simple structure. There is [one already](https://github.com/damu/UrhoSampleProject), but it's not official and has not been updated for a while.

data.title: Round to nearest EVEN number
data.body:
Unity uses Banker's rounding https://docs.unity3d.com/ScriptReference/Mathf.Round.html
Python 3 also: https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#round (but not Python 2 https://docs.python.org/2/library/functions.html#round)
C# also uses MidpointRounding.ToEven by default

data.title: Bind ResourceCache::GetResources.
data.body: Bind [ResourceCache::GetResources](https://urho3d.github.io/documentation/1.6/class_urho3_d_1_1_resource_cache.html#ada668dffb5057808c40306ffc26ff6d2) to AngelScript (this function was missed).

data.title: Update Transform.glsl
data.body: let the user define the number of outputs for advanced rendering effects such as subsurface scattering

data.title: Texture2D comment mistext
Object static type identification seems doesn't work
Postfix binary name to allow different builds in the same directory.
data.body:
Basically I would like to include a post-fix or something in the `Urho3D.dll/so` in order to be able to keep builds with different options in the same folder. So I could do things like `Urho3D_DX9.dll`, `Urho3D_DX11.dll`, `Urho3D_GL.dll` etc.

Is there something already similar in the build system? Maybe I missed it.

data.title: [Bug?] AngelScript binding miss Sort compare function callback support
data.body:
As Sort works very nicely with classes opCmp, there's flexibility problem as one have to implement class
for each way of sorting, which is very not nice and non-flexible.
AngelScript does support callbacks (even ones attached to object), why not use this mechanism to
support supplying sorting function to a Sort method?

```
  Could not check compiler toolchain CPU instruction extension as it does not
```


data.title: RTT Z-Buffer problem on Intel HD graphics
data.body:
![screenshot from 2017-03-25 02-38-43](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/25241174/24320018/efd48386-110a-11e7-9000-f7bffe7c6532.png)

I've noted this issue in 3 different laptops, 2 running Windows 7 and now 1 running Ubuntu 16.04.
The problem only seems to happen on RTT 's with Intel HD graphics chips.

In attempt to determinate this, I've compiled Urho3D with CMake with OpenGL API. I tested the same generated sample 10_RenderToTexture in a regular desktop with a GTX 970 and in a laptop with the HD graphics both running Ubuntu 16.04 with the same packages installed. The problem only occurred in the laptop with HD graphics.

Specs of the graphic chips used in the test.
Desktop - GeForce - GTX 970/PCIe/SSE2 - OpenGL version string: 4.5.0 NVIDIA 375.39
Laptop - Intel® HD Graphics 5500 (Broadwell GT2) - - OpenGL version string: 3.0 Mesa 17.0.1

There is another user that experienced the same bug here: [http://discourse.urho3d.io/t/rendering-to-texture-inverts-z-buffer-on-intel-hd-graphics/2259](url)

I'm not sure if this is actually a bug or if I've missed something while compiling Urho3D's source.

data.title: IntVector2 constants
data.body: Just some constants..

data.title: Allow root UI element to be moved.
data.body:
Root UI element can be resized, however setting it's position renders UI with bottom and right portions cut-off. Change fixes the issue and resized/positioned root UI element is rendered properly.

Before anyone asks - tested `GetElementAt()` and it works properly ;)

data.title: Forgotten Camera::autoAspectRatio_
Add Animation::GetTrack(unsigned)
data.body: This variant of Animation::GetTrack() is listed in the documentation but I couldn't see it implemented anywhere in the source code.

data.title: Inverse kinematics v1.0
data.body:
For the past few weeks I've been pushing development on a FABRIK based ik library of mine and I think it's reached a point where it's stable enough to be usable. I'd like to make it more accessible to the Urho3D community so I can get better feedback for future improvements.

The relevant forum thread can be found here: http://discourse.urho3d.io/t/inverse-kinematics/1819/43

An overview of the changes:
  + Included a new thirdparty library for solving IK
  + Added an URHO3D_IK build option, which is enabled by default
  + Added 3 components exposing the ik library to Urho3D
  + Added a new editor icon for the IKEffector component
  + Wrote AngelScript and Lua bindings (lua is currently untested)
  + Wrote a new sample (45_InverseKinematics) and ported it to AngelScript

Let me know if there is anything to be improved upon or changed.
